intro: Brodiaea capitata, commonly known as the showy brodiaea, is a flowering plant native to California and parts of Nevada. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect stem that bears a dense cluster of white to lilac-colored flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It produces small, rounded bulbs that store nutrients for the next growing season. Brodiaea capitata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its striking floral display.
